data.title: Client crash on host disconnect: Out of sync
data.body:
When playing RA mod, at the end of a LAN game the host disconnected, closing the server. Both connected clients crashed to desktop with the following exception:

```
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20140722
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.18444
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Out of sync in frame 9117.
 Compare syncreport.log with other players.
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.OutOfSync(Int32 frame)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.CheckSync(Byte[] packet)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.<TickImmediate>c__AnonStorey6C.<>m__11F(Int32 clientId, Byte[] packet)
   at OpenRA.Network.ReplayRecorderConnection.<Receive>c__AnonStorey6A.<>m__112(Int32 client, Byte[] data)
   at OpenRA.Network.EchoConnection.Receive(Action`2 packetFn)
   at OpenRA.Network.ReplayRecorderConnection.Receive(Action`2 packetFn)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.TickImmediate()
   at OpenRA.Sync.<CheckSyncUnchanged>c__AnonStorey3C.<>m__69()
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[T](World world, Func`1 fn)
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged(World world, Action fn)
   at OpenRA.Game.TickInner(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

Full logs:
http://www.mediafire.com/download/koa9eh1ccb7yo23/Client_crash_on_host_quit.zip

data.title: Walls cause lag
data.body:
If a passage is blocked by walls, like the middle area of Great Divide map, this causes the game to slow down to an unplayable rate.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3293760-walls-cause-lag?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Regression and UpgradeRules fix for #5921.
data.body:
Fixes the regression I caused in #5921.
Closes #6039.

data.title: New D2K UI
data.body:
In order to harmonize interfaces accross mods (see #5972 and #5108), here are some proposals about a possible new Dune2000 UI. For the moment, they are just WIP, mockups, ideas.

test1:
![dune2000_test1b](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/3670921/ab41ab3a-1249-11e4-9144-fac3cb727f1b.png)

test2 (the one I like least):
![dune2000_test2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/3670784/f54217b2-1247-11e4-9429-1fe15d160dcb.png)

test3:
![dune2000_test3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/3670888/51409574-1249-11e4-8a06-fae0f81423f7.png)

As you can see, the color of the small planet in the middle could change, depending on the faction (blue: atreides, green: ordos, red: harkonnen). Or maybe we want the whole UI to change its color, something like that: http://forum.dune2k.com/topic/25963-release-dune-2000-resource-editor/  ?

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3285282-new-d2k-ui?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fixed Atreides Barracks Make Anim.
data.body: This fixes atreides barracks was using same build anim of orther. But normally it has a special build anim.

data.title: Convert RenderAfterWorld to use Renderables.
data.body: This will allow PlaceBuildingOrderGenerator and other OGs to include voxels and other "advanced" rendering effects.

data.title: Regression in TD from #5921
data.body:
I apologise for this, but it seems I had missed https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/mods/cnc/rules/misc.yaml in my Crate Updates pull request.

This

```
GiveMcvCrateAction:
        SelectionShares: 0
        NoBaseSelectionShares: 120
        Unit: mcv
```

Should be this

```
GiveMcvCrateAction:
        SelectionShares: 0
        NoBaseSelectionShares: 120
        Units: mcv
```

I'll create the fix once I get home today. Otherwise, if someone else can shoot off a quick fix, I'd appreciate it.

Secondly, I realise now that I should have updated UpgradeRules as well. Will fix as soon as possible.

data.title: Documented FlyAwayOnIdle and ReturnOnIdle
data.body: As well as keep one trait per file.

data.title: Fixed walls not visually attaching to component towers
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6002.

data.title: Fixed country specific decimal separators in the traits documentation
data.body: I updated https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits from my de_DE machine manually as we currently don't have automatiation https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5900 and noticed the inconsistency. @x-a-n-a-x notified me of this issue few days ago and I did not believe him at first. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits#harvester FullyLoadedSpeed is a good example of this problem.

data.title: Merge RA aircraft queues
data.body: Split from #5972, this adds support for actors in the same queue to be built from different factories.

data.title: High difference for isometric maps in lobby (An idea for far in the future)
data.body:
I just though that having a bit of text in the lobby for TS/RA2 have is display the height difference like the map size in the lobby. this could give the play an indication of how hilly and treacherous the terrain could be on the map. Since the hills in the terrain should effect unit speed, and things like projectiles correct?

If its a stupid idea feel free to just throw this issue away, but something to think about way in the future :)

<bountysource-plugin>

---

data.title: Use a key modifier (e.g. shift) to disable line building
data.body:
Hi, I have found (while playing), that if you start to build up a wall, around your base (at least on the TD mod active, but I think even with the RA one), and you have another one, few cells away, the engine try to connect the two separate walls (even if around 7/8 cells away). I suggest that, while with the mouse you have a wall-piece, and you're deciding where to put it, you can limit the cell-row completion feature, pressing Left-Shift (to just put a single piece of wall, in the highlined cell), or Left-CTRL, just to have a more limited row-completion (of just around 5/6 cells-lenght), in order to ease the creation of siege protection walls around turrets. 

It would be a good idea having, by default, to put just one piece of wall and then, if the player want, extend the cell-lenght coverage, using the CTRL or Shift keyboard buttons.

data.title: Add hotkeys to focus production tabs
data.body: You can already use hotkeys to cycle through the production tabs, but it would be nice to be able to map hotkeys directly to specific tabs (eg. `q` -> infantry, `w` -> vehicles, etc). A nice side effect of this is that you could build any unit/structure with two key presses, no matter which tab is currently focused.

data.title: Custom Warheads refactor
data.body:
Split out just the refactor and work for the Custom Warheads.

This branch contains no changes to the yaml files other than what the UpradeRules does.

A short guide to how new custom warheads can be defined can be found here: http://pastebin.com/xUg2bfT5
Though the main purpose of this pull request is for regression testing.

Will allow functionality requested in #5436.

Supercedes  #5882. So implements functionality requested in #5618.

Lays groundwork for requests in #4363, solves some of them. (CreateSFX, DamageActor).

Lays groundwork for #2838.
@Phrohdoh has already done a lot of work towards mind control.

Once this pull request is accepted/complete, I'll create a new pull request for the DisabledByWarhead additions that build atop of this.

data.title: Move *Renderables and Render* out of Game.
data.body: Some simple reorganization that gets things in order for the nasty refactoring patch that will come next.

data.title: Can't find serverlist
data.body: Yesterday the game worked fine. I could join other people's servers and I've played for hours. Now the game can't find any servers. The refreshing bar stays on grey and nothing happens. No servers are found. I've already re-installed the game, restarted my computer, restarted the router, turned off my firewall but no luck so far. What should I do?

data.title: Revert "Make Shift+<Hotkey> queue five units/buildings. Fixes #5544."
data.body:
Reverts OpenRA/OpenRA#5763

Fixes #6024, which is worse than the original #5544.

data.title: Added "Pasty Mesa" map and some tile fixes
data.body:
Added anyother Westwood Studios map: "Pasty Mesa".
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7933210/3655120/300d844a-1175-11e4-9f12-82cbf427ebbc.png)
Also i fixed and moved some unidentified tiles and fixed some categories that not sorting at EditorTemplateOrder: and showing at top of editor. Fixed and Categorized tiles are;
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7933210/3655181/fcb8268a-1175-11e4-9249-3c055deb1156.png)

data.title: (Partly fixed in release 2016-10-19) Missing hold button scrolling
data.body:
If you hold a button and move the mouse in a direction (lets say 0-1 cm gives you slow speed, 1-2 cm faster, 2-3 cm faster even, etc. from the point the mouse was when scroll button was activated) you get scrolling in that direction until you change mouse direction or let go of the button.

Or scrolling until you press the button again, like a on/off scrolling button (especially useful for replays).

Xanaxs mockup of a possible in-game example: 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/3359165/8921ff8a-fae5-11e3-90c0-1d4eac7d5df4.gif)

Also see #5587, #5368

data.title: (Fixed in release 2014-07-22) Not able to select type in new playtest
data.body:
If i press CTRL+T with a vehicle selected all I get is a tech building etc.
Changed to "w" (default) in newer releases.

data.title: Removed support for yes/no values in favor of true/false.
Locomotion MovesToShroud bool.
data.body:
Added flag to MobileInfo: MovesToShroud.
Does not change the audio feedback given.

Closes #6017.

data.title: Give GTWR back to both factions.
data.body: Fixes a regression from #5685.

data.title: Cursor graphical glitches
data.body:
There is a very slight graphical error that occurs with cursors. The left and buttom most pixels appear to be duplicated pixels further in those directions. Try see what I mean with the attached image.

On the first you can see an extra "droopy" bit on the tip of the cursor. When hovering over the menu I get the those extra brown pixels there instead and with the movement cursor here there are some messy pixels on the left and bottom of the mouse frame.

![mouse_glitch1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8225171/3647406/343f8b8e-10fe-11e4-9c1c-0913fd1f71fc.png)

Also the deploy cursor wobbles around.

This DOESN'T appear to happen for the RA mod, only TS, Rewire and my own edit of the TS mod.

data.title: Shadows "multiply"
data.body:
See below, the shadow for the structure and it's animation overlap and create a darker shadow.

![shadow_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8225171/3647334/6731820a-10fd-11e4-9a43-acd2b72299a9.png)
